refnamediv.refpurpose: This function is used to detect MSER features

refsynopsisdiv.title: Calling Sequence
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: list_pixels = detectMSERFeatures(image, Name, Value... ) [list_pixels Count Location Axes Orientation] = detectMSERFeatures(image, Name, Value... )

listitem.para: Input Image, should be a 2-D grayscale. The Input Image should be real
Step Size between intensity to be checked for measurement of stability. Values: Percentage numeric value. Default: 2.0
Size of the region in Pixels specified as [minArea maxArea]. Default Value: [30 14000]
Specify a rectangular region of operation. Format [ x y width height ]. Default: [1 1 size(Image,2) size(Image,1)]
Maximum Area Variation between external regions at varying thresholds for determination of stability. Values in range of (0,1]. Default 0.25
Array of point coordinates for detected regions
A M-by-2 Matrix of [x y] coordinates of centroid of the ellipsoidal fit to the region
Count of the number of stable regions detected
A M-by-2 Matrix of [majorAxis minorAxis] values for each ellipsoidal fit to the detected regions
A M-by-1 Vector containing the angle of orientation of the ellipsoidal fit in the range of [-pi/2 +pi/2] radians

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function is used to detect the MSER regions, and also the corresponding ellipsoidal fit to the detected regions.
